title: JavaTutorial

metadata.description: Learn about JavaTutorial with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Learn Java
Java is a popular programming language.
Java is used to develop mobile apps, web apps, desktop apps, games and much 
more.
Start learning Java now »
Examples in Each Chapter
Our "
in your browser.
Example
public class Main {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    System.out.println("Hello World");
  }
}

Click on the "Run example" button to see how it works.
We recommend reading this tutorial, in the sequence listed in the left menu.
Java is an object oriented language and some concepts may be new. Take breaks when needed, and go
over the examples as many times as needed.
Java Exercises
Many chapters in this tutorial end with an exercise where you can check your level of knowledge.
See all Java Exercises
Java Quiz
Test your Java skills with a quiz.
Start Java Quiz
Learn by Examples
Learn by examples! This tutorial supplements all explanations with clarifying examples.
See All Java Examples

Create a free  account and get access to more features and learning materials:
View your completed tutorials, exercises, and quizzes
Keep an eye on your progress and daily streaks
Set goals and create learning paths
Create your own personal website

Note:
This is an optional feature. You can study at  without creating an account.
Java Reference
You will also find complete keyword and method references:
Java Keywords
Java String Methods
Java Math Methods
Java Output Methods
Java Arrays Methods
Java ArrayList Methods
Java LinkedList Methods
Java HashMap Methods
Java Scanner Methods
Java Iterator Methods
Java Errors and Exception Types

practice_exercises.description: Create a function that demonstrates the concepts from this tutorial.

quiz.question: What is Java?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of Java is 'used to develop mobile apps'.

summary: This tutorial covers JavaTutorial concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use JavaTutorial effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of JavaTutorial and how to apply it in your projects.
